description: Early Modern French rechercher (“to examine closely”), from Old French recerchier (“to seek, to look for”).

entries.meaning: (uncountable, countable in some dialects) Diligent inquiry or examination to seek or revise facts, principles, theories, applications, etc.; laborious or continued search after truth.
examples: The research station that houses Wang and his team is outside Lijiang, a city of about 1.2 million people.

entries.meaning: (countable, dated) A particular instance or piece of research.
examples: The first step I took in this so necessary a research, was to examine the motives, the justice, the necessity and expediency of the revolution […]

verbs.description: research (third-person singular simple present researches, present participle researching, simple past and past participle researched)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To search or examine with continued care; to seek diligently.
(intransitive) To make an extensive investigation into.
